attributes.action: Award 23892771 Sgt Talaiasi Labalaba BEM & MiD 22 SASR the Victoria Cross
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
July 1972 Sergeant Talaiasi Labalaba from B Squadron 22 Special Air Service Regiment fell mortally wounded in the gun pit at Mirbat in Southern Oman during the Dhofar Insurgency Campaign whilst defending the town from invasion of nearly 400 communist insurgents.
Laba who was a Fijian by birth repeatedly loaded the 25 pounder and kept firing over open sights until a bullet struck him in the neck.
His actions and that of the other members of B Squadron BATT team kept the Adoo pinned at the towns perimeter defences whilst a relief force from G Squadron was on the way by helicopter from Salalah. They saved a lot of lives during this conflict that most people had never heard of.
The Victoria Cross was instituted by Queen Victoria on the 5th February 1856 as a means of rewarding an officer or man of the Army or Navy who might perform some signal act of valor or devotion to his country in the presence of the enemy.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
